attributes.action: Make it compulsory for councils to warn of lethal risks of recycling caddies.
attributes.additional_details:
Below is a council website link failing to warn of food bin fatal mould risks:

http://www.chiltern.gov.uk/foodwaste

The Wheelhouse Veterinary Centre is 1 of 3 vet groups involved trying to save these dogs.Below is a link to their post:

https://www.facebook.com/TheWheelhouseVets/posts/1422334514507038

The owners emotional trauma & surprise to the public is evident,as are the costs obvious.

Currently 800+ comments,1000+ reactions,7000+ shares in < 3 days highlights the lack of risk awareness.
attributes.background: Toxic mould from recycling bins can be fatal to people & pets like cats & dogs due to Mycotoxicosis risks.2 dogs recently, nearly died due to this & 1 is still fighting for its life.Councils are currently failing to warn of potential lethal risks.We ask you to ensure they do so under a duty of care.

rejection.details:
Two petitions from the same creator were submitted on the same issue. One has been accepted and the other was rejected as a duplicate.

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/184878
